@graph.description: An example Workflow RO-Crate, showing a Galaxy workflow with an abstract CWL description and diagram. This Crate is deliberately excessively populated to show the exensible possibilities (e.g. including a BioCompute Object and a Planemo test), refer to the Workflow RO-Crate profile for minimal requirements.
@graph.name: Hello World
Galaxy History of Hello World example run

@graph.description: Example output of the last (aka first of reversed) lines
@graph.name: Select_first_on_data_1_2 (output)

@graph.description: Example input, a simple text file
@graph.name: abcdef (input)

@graph.description: Alternative representation of the Galaxy workflow execution using IEEE Std 2791-2020
@graph.name: BioCompute Object a3a1d27edb703e5c

@graph.description: Example output of the reversed lines
@graph.name: tac_on_data_360_1 (output)
Diagram of the Hello World workflow

@graph.description: Note that Planemo has strict path expectations for its job file vs the tested workflow, therefore the -test.yml is in the root rather than under test/
@graph.name: Planemo tests for workflow
Creating, Editing and Importing Galaxy Workflows (Galaxy Training Materials)
